Steps to reporduce issue.
- Try to preview the attached report

Created an attachment (id=64661)
Sample report design

This is not a bug. For each dimension, we should at least have a unique key so that fact table data can reference to it based on that unique key. And that key usually would be members of leaf level. So any member of a leaf level should have one and only one parent in its parent level. If a "key" member have more than one parent that means it cannot serve as primary key of a dimension table.

In attached report design, the City "Glendale" belong to two states, which means it cannot serve as key of the dimension. To fix this, we should either filter it out from dimension table, or simply add a new leaf level under it, which can serve as dimension key.
I think we can't assume the members on a leaf level to be unique.  This restriction will make it also impossible to create a cube. By definition, a hierarchy in a dimension is the key that will be used to join with the fact table, e.g, the key is Country.State.City for Location which has three levels: Country, State, City. Definitely you can have two cities with the same name. 

The following has been agreed.

Solution Agreed based on meeting with Gary and Wenbin

1) We will add a new Boolean flag to each ?level? called ?isUnique?.

If ?isUnique? = true, then DtE will use the level key as the unique key to identify the member.

If ?isUnique?=false, then DtE will use the compound key = all the parent keys uniquely identify the member.

Model ? Will be enhanced to levelView to add the new Boolean flat ?isUnique?. By default it is false.

UI ? Aashima will update the mockups to allow user to set this flag.

 

Later Wenbin and me had another discussion, in addition to above we propose the following change.

2) We also add a new optional field on level called ?displayField?, this will allow user to set a displayField different from key field ( similar to the one we have in cascading parameter )

- Level key is the only required field.

- When rendering the cross tab, we use the displayField if it is provided, or else we use the level Key

- This will impact java script too.

Comment from Gary

The impact on Javascript is: Dimension[?D?]Level[?L?] will return the value of the displayField if it is defined; otherwise it returns level key. 

 
Also a minor correction on the implementation of isUnique: when a level has isUnique == false, DTE will compound the immediate parent?s key, and if the parent has isUnique == false, it?s parent?s parent?s key, etc. Basically the compound key chain stops at the first ancestor that has isUnique set to true
*** Bug 183906 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
The bug is fixed.

Please note that the attached report design include a very large crosstab so it will take sometime to generate it.

traces.message: The detail member Glendale have more than one parent.
Fail to load cube "Customer Cube" from document. The document object does not exist.
